column4: it's a little more intuitive as of edgy, but I agree (and I use xubuntu!)
i'm running Xfce as well, i enjoy it, but miss some of the intuitive features that Gnome / Nautilus had
but you'll have to agree that Thunar is nice, eh?
Thunar is nice, it's fast and responsive. it just doesn't seem to interact with the automounting as well as i'd like
